ygData.subject: Re: SV: Q: Odd situation...?
ygData.msgSnippet: Yup... Both have cracked staves (he recently swapped his for one an Orc had just in case his was faulty - lol), same skin like wood buff - in fact mine
ygData.messageBody:
Yup... Both have cracked staves (he recently "swapped" his for one an
Orc had just in case his was "faulty" - lol), same "skin like wood"
buff - in fact mine wears off and I often forget to put it back on.
:o/ I gave him some of my armor, making his AC higher than mine, and
then he went and bought some more (I haven't heard the end of that
one, yet... :oP ) and *still* he's hitting for these puny amounts and
missing a lot (and therefore getting hit more often himself). I told
him to make a new character and see if he advances better with that
one, but he doesn't *want* a new character ::whine whine::. We're
only lvl 6, it's not like it would take forever to work his way back
up to it. Oh, well, he'll survive...or not. :) Thanks!

Lliani

On Thu, 4 Nov 1999 05:31:12 +0100, you wrote:

>From: "Avron Elselynn" <avron@...>
>
>Are you also using the same equipment and weapons? Also buffs have alot to do with it, if you have a strength buff you will harder and more often...
>
>- Avron -
>
>
>> From: alliani@... (Randy & Lori Alliani)
>>
>> My husband and I play EQ on a networked setup. We created our
>> characters at the same time, we're both Wood Elf Druids. We
>> distributed our extra 30 stat points the same. We group most of the
>> time so level just about the same time. We even have the same AC and
>> HP within a couple of points.
<snip>
